thread.title: More than 100 years of Peter Pan
thread.title_full: More than 100 years of Peter Pan - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: More than 100 years of Peter Pan
text:
Photo: Courtesy Movie Studios Image 1 of / 18 18 In the new film "Pan" Levi Miller plays a 12-year-old orphan named Peter who gets whisked away to Neverland. Hugh Jackman plays Blackbeard the pirate.
Photo: Courtesy Movie Studios In the new film "Pan" Levi Miller plays a 12-year-old orphan named... Image 2 of 18 Dan Rosales takes flight as Peter Pan in "Peter Pan 360," opened in Houston in September 2015 and runs through Oct. 25.
Photo: Jeremy Daniel Dan Rosales takes flight as Peter Pan in "Peter Pan 360," opened... Image 3 of 18 Allison Williams played Peter Pan in a live telecast on NBC in 2014.
Photo: NBC, Virginia Sherwood/NBC Allison Williams played Peter Pan in a live telecast on NBC in 2014. Image 4 of 18 Williams and "Peter Pan Live!" were not very well received by critics.
Photo: Nino Munoz/ Williams and "Peter Pan Live!" were not very well received by critics. Image 5 of 18 ﻿Author J.M. Barrie﻿, who wrote "Peter Pan" and based the characters on a family he knew.
Photo: handout ﻿Author J.M. Barrie﻿, who wrote "Peter Pan" and based the... Image 6 of 18 A 1911 edition of "Peter Pan: The Story of Peter and Wendy," by J.M.Barrie.
Photo: Shaan Kokin, AP A 1911 edition of "Peter Pan: The Story of Peter and Wendy," by... Image 7 of 18 Maude Adams was the first actor to play Peter Pan on Broadway.
Photo: handout Maude Adams was the first actor to play Peter Pan on Broadway. Image 8 of 18 The first movie version of "Peter Pan" was a silent film released in 1924 with Betty Bronson playing Peter.
Photo: Paramount The first movie version of "Peter Pan" was a silent film released... Image 9 of 18 Bobby Driscoll voiced Peter Pan in the animated 1953 Disney production.
Photo: Disney C Bobby Driscoll voiced Peter Pan in the animated 1953 Disney... Image 10 of 18 "Peter Pan" was the highest grossing film of 1953.
Photo: Credit "Peter Pan" was the highest grossing film of 1953. Image 11 of 18 Mary Martin takes flight as Peter Pan on Broadway in 1954.
Photo: handout Mary Martin takes flight as Peter Pan on Broadway in 1954. Image 12 of 18 NBC aired "Peter Pan" in 1976 with Mia Farrow in the title role.
Photo: NBC NBC aired "Peter Pan" in 1976 with Mia Farrow in the title role. Image 13 of 18 Cathy Rigby was a gymnast in the 1968 Olympics who has played Pan in theater productions for more than 30 years.
Photo: JOHN MARSHALL MANTEL, STR Cathy Rigby was a gymnast in the 1968 Olympics who has played Pan... Image 14 of 18
In Steven Spielberg's 1991 film "Hook" Robin Williams played Peter as a middle-aged father whose children are abducted by his old nemesis Captain Hook. Julia Roberts played Tinkerbell.
Photo: Photo By Columbia Tristar, Getty Images In Steven Spielberg's 1991 film "Hook" Robin Williams played Peter...
Image 15 of 18 Dustin Hoffman played the sinister captain in Spielberg's "Hook."
Photo: TriStar Pictures Dustin Hoffman played the sinister captain in Spielberg's "Hook." Image 16 of 18 The 2004 film "Finding Neverland" cast Johnny Depp as J.M. Barrie and told the story of how his famous tale was created.
Photo: Miramax Films The 2004 film "Finding Neverland" cast Johnny Depp as J.M. Barrie... Image 17 of 18 Jeremy Sumpter played Peter in a 2003 film version of "Peter Pan."
Photo: AP Jeremy Sumpter played Peter in a 2003 film version of "Peter Pan." Image 18 of 18 More than 100 years of Peter Pan 1 / 18 Back to Gallery Filmmaker Joe Wright is the latest storyteller to present characters created by writer J.M. Barrie, who conceived of Peter Pan and his friends in Neverland. "Pan" follows young orphan Peter as he's first taken to the magical world, where he meets new friends and makes new enemies.
Barrie first introduced the character in the early 1900s, and in addition to novels, Peter Pan has since found his way into Broadway shows, films, ballets and other productions. "Peter Pan 360," a live show, continues in Houston until Oct. 25. Here is a look at more than a century of Peter Pan.
